questions.question: As it is used in paragraph 6, the word risks refers to —
options: breaks in a routine
suggestions from others
skills that are difficult to learn
actions that could lead to failure
questions.correctAnswer: actions that could lead to failure

questions.question: Read this sentence from paragraph 2. 'In fact, it's difficult to imagine a world today without grocery store check-out counters lined with colorful packages of minty or fruit-flavored gum.' The description in this sentence helps the reader understand that —
options: gum has become more expensive
gum is a common and popular product
shoppers often forget to buy gum until the last minute
there are more flavors of gum than there used to be
questions.correctAnswer: gum is a common and popular product

questions.question: Based on the author's descriptions of Wrigley's career, the reader can infer that Wrigley —
options: gave away more gum than he sold
did not try to help the family business
rarely learned from his own experiences
was not afraid to try new approaches
questions.correctAnswer: was not afraid to try new approaches

questions.question: The reader knows that this selection is a biography because it —
options: explains why so many people enjoy chewing Wrigley's gum
tells about the events in Wrigley's life that led to his success
tells why Wrigley decided to start selling chewing gum
explains Wrigley's belief that advertising was important
questions.correctAnswer: tells about the events in Wrigley's life that led to his success

questions.question: Based on the selection, how does the author most likely feel about Wrigley?
options: The author admires Wrigley for his interesting ideas and hard work.
The author is amazed that Wrigley's simple methods brought him success.
The author is bothered by the fact that Wrigley made so few gum flavors.
The author wishes Wrigley had used his talents on something other than gum.
questions.correctAnswer: The author admires Wrigley for his interesting ideas and hard work.

questions.question: Which theme is best supported by details in this selection?
options: Finding joy in personal work can lead to success.
Working with others is the best way to solve a problem.
Thinking creatively helps people achieve their goals.
Showing respect to the boss is an important part of any job.
questions.correctAnswer: Thinking creatively helps people achieve their goals.

questions.question: In paragraph 4, what does the word irritating mean?
options: Low
Curious
Nervous
Annoying
questions.correctAnswer: Annoying

questions.question: The conversation between Opal and Otis in paragraphs 10 through 18 suggests that Otis is —
options: disappointed that he is not going to sell anything
uncertain about whether to hire Opal
ashamed of the mess in the pet store
worried about what Opal will do next
questions.correctAnswer: uncertain about whether to hire Opal

questions.question: In paragraph 25, the most likely reason Otis says 'You can start on Monday' is that he —
options: realizes that Gertrude is not bothered by the dog
wants to spend more time with Winn-Dixie
knows that he needs help keeping the store clean
does not want Opal to suggest more ideas
questions.correctAnswer: realizes that Gertrude is not bothered by the dog

questions.question: What is the main message of the story?
options: People who have courage will find that there is nothing to fear.
People who want to work for others must always keep their promises.
People who do not give up are more likely to get what they want.
People who work hard are more successful in life than those who do not.
questions.correctAnswer: People who do not give up are more likely to get what they want.

questions.question: Which of these events from the story causes Otis to consider giving Opal a job?
options: Opal finds a leash and a collar that Winn-Dixie likes.
Otis explains that the parrot does not like being around dogs.
Otis learns that Winn-Dixie howls when he is away from Opal.
Opal mentions some chores that she could do at the pet store.
questions.correctAnswer: Opal mentions some chores that she could do at the pet store.

questions.question: What is the best summary of the story?
options: A girl finds a collar and a leash that she likes in the pet store, but she realizes that they cost too much money. She asks the worker if she can make a plan to pay for them. He tells her that the owner wouldn't like that idea. A parrot keeps interrupting their conversation, but the girl continues talking to the worker.

A girl wants to buy a collar and a leash at a pet store, but she does not have enough money. She asks if she can pay over time, but the worker says no. Next she asks if she can pay by working in the store, but the worker is not sure. He agrees at last after he sees how well her dog and the store parrot get along.

A girl takes her dog to a pet store one day. She leaves her dog outside and goes into the store to find a leash and a collar. The girl meets a worker and the store parrot named Gertrude. The parrot does not like dogs, but the girl thinks it will like her dog because her dog is very nice.

A girl chooses a leash and a collar that she likes and shows them to her dog. She wants to buy them, but she doesn't have enough money. The girl notices that the store needs cleaning, so she offers to clean the store to earn money to buy the items for her dog.
questions.correctAnswer: A girl wants to buy a collar and a leash at a pet store, but she does not have enough money. She asks if she can pay over time, but the worker says no. Next she asks if she can pay by working in the store, but the worker is not sure. He agrees at last after he sees how well her dog and the store parrot get along.

questions.question: The author includes paragraph 2 in the selection most likely to —
options: describe some good things that bats do
share ideas people have about bats
explain why bats eat so many insects
persuade people to visit bat caves
questions.correctAnswer: describe some good things that bats do

questions.question: According to the selection, why are bats having difficulty finding homes?
options: Bats need places to hang from while they sleep.
Bats are bothered by people who explore caves.
People build on the land where bats once lived.
People are not building bat houses correctly.
questions.correctAnswer: People build on the land where bats once lived.

questions.question: Which sentence from the selection expresses an opinion?
options: The fertilizer mixes with the soil and makes it richer, which helps plants grow.
More plants mean more food for people and animals.
Today there are many people who build homes for bats.
Giving a bat a home is a great way to help these useful creatures.
questions.correctAnswer: Giving a bat a home is a great way to help these useful creatures.

questions.question: Which section from the selection describes ways that bats can help people?
options: The introductory paragraph
The section titled 'Bat Benefits'
The section titled 'Giving Back to Bats'
The section titled 'Bat Houses'
questions.correctAnswer: The section titled 'Bat Benefits'

questions.question: The author's purpose for including paragraph 5 in the article most likely is to —
options: explain the problems honeybees are experiencing
state the benefits of taking care of honeybees
describe ways to care for the honeybee population
show why honeybees are good to have around
questions.correctAnswer: describe ways to care for the honeybee population

questions.question: What happens when the land where bees live is turned into farmland?
options: Honeybees find less pollen and nectar.
Honeybees catch dangerous diseases.
Honeybees spread sickness to the plants.
Honeybees eat too much of the crops.
questions.correctAnswer: Honeybees find less pollen and nectar.

questions.question: What problem would most likely occur if there were too few honeybees?
options: There would be much less healthy food to eat.
Diseases would spread more quickly.
There would be more farms where bees once lived.
More harmful insects would be alive.
questions.correctAnswer: There would be much less healthy food to eat.

questions.question: What is the best summary of the section titled 'How Humans Can Help'?
options: Beekeepers are people who try to keep bees healthy. Ian Snyder is a student who says this is very important. He participates in a beekeeping program at his school.
If children want to help honeybees, they should learn about honeybees and the plants that bees like. Many schools offer classes that help students learn about honeybees living in their area.
Honeybees like plants such as cabbage, sunflowers, and strawberries. People who want to help honeybees should try to grow plants like these.
Anyone can help honeybees. People can grow plants that honeybees like. They can also build beehives. Some schools are teaching students how to be beekeepers and keep bees healthy.
questions.correctAnswer: Anyone can help honeybees. People can grow plants that honeybees like. They can also build beehives. Some schools are teaching students how to be beekeepers and keep bees healthy.

questions.question: Based on details in both 'Night Flyers' and 'A Sweet Part of Nature,' the reader can tell that bats and honeybees are responsible for —
options: fewer insects eating crops
more people starting new farms
fewer animals getting sick from diseases and viruses
more food being produced because of pollination
questions.correctAnswer: more food being produced because of pollination

questions.question: The first photograph in 'Night Flyers' and the last photograph in 'A Sweet Part of Nature' both show that —
options: these animals enjoy being near people
there are more of these animals than people may think
people are interested in these animals
it is easy for people to help these animals
questions.correctAnswer: people are interested in these animals

questions.question: What is one way that the bats in 'Night Flyers' and the honeybees in 'A Sweet Part of Nature' are different?
options: Bats eat insects, while bees do not.
Bats spread pollen, while bees do not.
Bats catch diseases, while bees do not.
Bats need new houses, while bees do not.
questions.correctAnswer: Bats eat insects, while bees do not.

questions.question: Read this sentence from paragraph 2 of 'Night Flyers.' 'Bats also spread pollen among flowering plants.' Which sentence from 'A Sweet Part of Nature' best shows a way that honeybees are similar to bats?
options: When people think of bees, they may also think of the sweet taste of the honey that bees make.
The wildflowers and plants that bees feed on have been replaced with crops, which limits honeybees' access to nectar and pollen.
Bees pollinate a wide variety of plants in the United States.
People can grow flowers and plants that honeybees like, such as cabbage, sunflowers, and strawberries.
questions.correctAnswer: Bees pollinate a wide variety of plants in the United States.

questions.question: In line 19, the word musses means —
options: gets wet
makes clean
removes from a location
rearranges in an untidy way
questions.correctAnswer: rearranges in an untidy way

questions.question: Read lines 5 through 9 of the poem. 'Air smells like roses sometimes, or fresh-cut grass; gasoline or rain or skunk.' Why does the poet include descriptive language in these lines?
options: To persuade the reader to spend more time outdoors
To tell the reader that air can smell like many things after it rains
To explain how the smell of roses is different from the smell of skunk
To emphasize that air can be both pleasant and unpleasant
questions.correctAnswer: To emphasize that air can be both pleasant and unpleasant

questions.question: Line 38 is different from the other lines of the poem most likely because the poet wants to —
options: show that this line should be read quickly
add humor to the poem by spelling the word incorrectly
emphasize the idea expressed in the line
suggest that this is the most important word in the poem
questions.correctAnswer: emphasize the idea expressed in the line

questions.question: Which line from the poem best shows that air can be powerful?
options: The sky is made of air.
It tears leaves off trees
It has no color or shape
or blow a soap bubble.
questions.correctAnswer: It tears leaves off trees

questions.question: The speaker in the poem believes that the difference between wind and air is that wind is —
options: colder
thinner
smelly
moving
questions.correctAnswer: moving

questions.question: What can the reader conclude about the speaker's ideas about air throughout the poem?
options: The speaker has changed his mind about air.
The speaker wishes that air could be seen.
The speaker thinks that air has qualities that make it special.
The speaker is confused by his thoughts about air.
questions.correctAnswer: The speaker thinks that air has qualities that make it special.

questions.question: Read this dictionary entry for the word drive. Which definition most closely fits the way the word drives is used in paragraph 1?
options: Definition 1: to take to another place by car
Definition 2: to guide the movement of
Definition 3: to force to go through
Definition 4: to throw hard or fast
questions.correctAnswer: Definition 3: to force to go through

questions.question: Based on information in the selection, how do Brooks and Bol most likely feel about the results of their plan?
options: Disappointed
Curious
Delighted
Confused
questions.correctAnswer: Delighted

questions.question: The photograph and caption above paragraph 8 are included in the selection to show —
options: why some of the libraries become more popular than others
how library owners must refill their libraries every day
what steps people use to check books out of the libraries
how the libraries help people share and enjoy books
questions.correctAnswer: how the libraries help people share and enjoy books

questions.question: Which sentence best completes the diagram? CAUSE: Bol builds the first Little Free Library. EFFECT: ?
options: Bol wants to honor his mother.
Bol thinks his friends do not have enough books.
Bol wants people to learn to share with others.
Bol notices that libraries make people want to read.
questions.correctAnswer: Bol wants to honor his mother.

questions.question: The author wrote this selection mainly to —
options: provide information about where to find a Little Free Library
explain why people enjoy reading books outdoors
persuade the reader to visit a Little Free Library
tell the reader about an interesting way to share books
questions.correctAnswer: tell the reader about an interesting way to share books

questions.question: What is the best summary of the selection?
options: A man made a little box and filled it with books for people to borrow. The box was shaped like a red schoolhouse. The man's friends and neighbors loved the little library and soon wanted to have tiny libraries of their own.

A man built a box in his yard and filled it with books. His neighbors liked the little library, so the man and his friend decided to help get little libraries started everywhere. Today many people enjoy getting books and meeting new friends at the little libraries.

A man thought of an idea to make a tiny library. Books are placed in a box and then put in a front yard. People do not need library cards and can just take the books for free anytime they want. They can return them whenever they are finished.
A man and his friend decided to try to get people around the world to build little libraries. They created a website to teach people how. Their goal was to build more libraries than Andrew Carnegie.
questions.correctAnswer: A man built a box in his yard and filled it with books. His neighbors liked the little library, so the man and his friend decided to help get little libraries started everywhere. Today many people enjoy getting books and meeting new friends at the little libraries.
